classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any Free Elective course can go here. Recommended: MATH151.

Eight units of Free Elective credit needed to reach 180 units. Math workshops are strongly recommended and require concurrent enrollment in the associated Math course. Each workshop will coutn as one unit of elective credit. CR/NR grading.

Eight units of Free Elective credit needed to reach 180 units. Math workshops are strongly recommended and require concurrent enrollment in the associated Math course. Each workshop will coutn as one unit of elective credit. CR/NR grading.

Any Statistics Elective course can go here. Statistics Electives (24 units). List A (12 units): STAT405, STAT414, STAT415, STAT416, STAT417, STAT418, STAT419, STAT421, STAT423, STAT434. List B (12 units): any 400-level STAT course (including from List A); CSC/CPE202, CSC/CPE203; CSC248, CSC349, CSC365, CSC369; DATA301; IME430; ITP303; MATH242, MATH306, MATH334, MATH335, MATH406, MATH412, MATH413, MATH414, MATH437, MATH451.
